nesterov_smooth¶

Module: nesterov_smooth¶

Reference¶

Nesterov, Y. “Smooth minimization of non-smooth functions.” Math. Program. 103 (2005), no. 1, Ser. A, 127–152.

Functions¶

regreg.nesterov_smooth.loop(x0, gradf, L, Qinfo=None, maxiter=100, solver=<function naive_solver at 0xa10095c>, f=None, tol=9.9999999999999998e-13, values=False, miniter=4, prox_center=None)¶
This is the loop (3.11) on p.135.
Parameters :

x0 : np.float

Starting point. It has shape (p,).

gradf : callable

This evaluates $

abla f(x)$. It should take one argument of shape (p,). :

L : np.float

Lipschitz constant of $

abla f$, the gradient of :

the function we are trying to minimize.

Qinfo : (np.float, np.float)

A tuple (Q, sigma) where Q is the matrix in the prox-function (ridge penalty) and sigma is its smallest eigenvalue. Defaults to (np.identity(p), 1).

sigma : np.float

Convexity parameter of $d(x)=x’Qx/2$, which we can take to be the smallest eigenvalue of $Q$.

solver : callable

A function that will solve a system of the form $Qa=b$. It should take two arguments: (Q,b).

f : callable

The function we are trying to minimize. If present, then the value of the objective can be returned, and (3.14) of the reference can be used in order to have a monotone descent of $f(y_k)$.

tol : float

If f is not None, used to determine convergence based on the objective function.

values : bool

If True, and f is not None return the values of $f(y_k)$.

miniter : int

Minimum number of iterations to run.

prox_center : np.float

A center for the prox function in the primal space. Should have shape (p,). Defaults to 0.
Returns :

x : np.float

This is the solution to (3.11) after maxiter steps.
regreg.nesterov_smooth.naive_solver(Q, b)¶

A solver that returns b if Q=None, else np.linalg.solve(Q,b).

regreg.nesterov_smooth.parameters(maxiter=100)¶

These are the $lpha_k, au_k, A_k$ of (3.10)

regreg.nesterov_smooth.solve_y(gradf_x, x, L)¶
This solves for $y_k$ on p.132.
Parameters :

gradf_x : np.float

This is $

abla f(x)$. It has shape (p,). :

x : np.float

This has shape (p,)

L : np.float

Lipschitz constant of $

abla f$, the gradient of :

the function we are trying to minimize.
Returns :

y : np.float

This is the solution to (3.2) on p.132. It is just x - gradf_x / L
regreg.nesterov_smooth.solve_z(momentum, L, Qinfo=None, solver=<function naive_solver at 0xa10095c>, prox_center=None)¶
This solves for $z_k$ on p.133. We assume the prox function here is $d(x)=x’Qx/2$.
Parameters :

momentum : np.float

This is the expression $sum_i lpha_i

abla f(x_i)$ in :

the reference. It has shape (p,)

L : np.float

Lipschitz constant of $

abla f$, the gradient of :

the function we are trying to minimize. That is, $

abla f$ should :

satisfy

$$ |

abla f(x) - :

abla f(y)| leq L |x-y| :

$$

Qinfo : (np.float, np.float)

A tuple (Q, sigma) where Q is the matrix in the prox-function (ridge penalty) and sigma is its smallest eigenvalue. Defaults to (np.identity(p), 1).

solver : callable

A function that will solve a system of the form $Qa=b$. It should take two arguments: (Q,b).

prox_center : np.float

A center for the prox function in the primal space. Should have shape (p,). Defaults to 0.
Returns :

z : np.float
